info.title: Customers V3
info.description:
- [OAuth Scopes](#oauth-scopes)
- [Authentication](#authentication)
- [Available Endpoints](#available-endpoints)
- [Resources](#resources)

Introduction

## OAuth Scopes
| UI Name                                      | Permission | Parameter                                     |
|----------------------------------------------|------------|-----------------------------------------------|
| Customers                                    | modify     | `store_v2_customers`                          |
| Customers                                    | read-only  | `store_v2_customers_read_only`                |

For more information on OAuth Scopes, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Authentication

Requests can be authenticated by sending a `client_id` and `access_token` via `X-Auth-Client` and `X-Auth-Token` HTTP headers:

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Accept: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Available Endpoints
| Resource / Endpoint                     | Description                                                             |
|-----------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Customers                               | Create an manage customers                                              |
| Customers Addresses                     | Create an manage customers Addresses                                    |
| Customers Attribute Values              | Create and manage customer attribute values                             |
| Customers Attributes                    | Create and manage customer attributes                                   |
| Customers Form Field Values             | Create an manage customer form field values                             |

## Resources
* [Customer and Subscribers Overview](/api-docs/customers/customers-subscribers-overview).

get.description:
Returns a list of [*Customers*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/models/customer). Optional filter parameters can be passed in.

**Notes**

Attribute names are not available on the customer object.

parameters.name: date_modified:min
parameters.description: Filter items by mininum date_modified. `date_modified:min=2019-09-04T:00:00:00` or `date_modified:min=2019-09-04`

parameters.name: date_modified:max
parameters.description: Filter items by maximum date_modified `date_modified:max=2018-09-05T13:45:03` or `date_modified:max=2019-09-04`

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter items by first_name and last_name. `name=moriarty,holmes`

parameters.name: name:like
parameters.description:
Filter items by substring in first_name and last_name (%substring% - use with % symbols).
`name:like=moriarty&name:like=doe`

parameters.name: registration_ip_address:in
parameters.description:
Filter items by registration_ip_address. If the customer was created using the API, then registration address is blank.
`registration_ip_address:in=12.345.6.789`

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to include customer sub-resources:
 * `addresses` - customer addresses
 * `storecredit` - store credit
 * `attributes` - customer attributes and address attributes
 * `formfields` - customer and address form fields

 `include=addresses,storecredit,attributes,formfields`

schema.title: CustomerCollectionResponse
schema.description: Response payload for the BigCommerce API.

email.description: The email of the customer. Must be unique.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

company.description: The company of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

registration_ip_address.description: The IP address from which this customer was registered.

tax_exempt_category.description: The tax exempt category code for the customer.

customer_group_id.description: Id of the group which this customer belongs to.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the customer.

date_modified.description: The date on which the customer was modified.

date_created.description: The date of which the customer was created.

force_password_reset.description: If `true`, this customer will be forced to change password on next login.

addresses.description: Array of customer addresses. Limited to 10

first_name.description: The first name of the customer address.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer address.

company.description: The company of the customer address.

city.description: The city of the customer address.

postal_code.description: The postal code of the customer address.

country_code.description: The country code of the customer address.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer address.

address_type.title: Address Type
address_type.description: The address type. Residential or Commercial

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the address.

country.description: The country name of the customer address.

form_fields.description: Array of form fields. Controlled by `formfields` parameter.

attributes.description: Array of customer attributes. Limited to 10

value.description: Attribute value. This will always be a string, regardless of the attributes type.

id.description: Attribute value ID.

date_modified.description: The date on which the customer attribute value was modified.

date_created.description: The date of which the customer attribute value was created.

form_fields.description: Array of form fields. Controlled by `formfields` parameter.

accepts_product_review_abandoned_cart_em.description: It determines if the customer is signed up to receive either product review or abandoned cart emails or recieve both emails.

meta.title: Collection Meta
meta.description: Data about the response, including pagination and collection totals.

pagination.title: Pagination
pagination.description: Data about the response, including pagination and collection totals.

total.description: Total number of items in the result set.

count.description: Total number of items in the collection response.

per_page.description: The amount of items returned in the collection per page, controlled by the limit parameter.

current_page.description: The page you are currently on within the collection.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages in the collection.

links.title: Links
links.description: Pagination links for the previous and next parts of the whole collection.

previous.description: Link to the previous page returned in the response.

current.description: Link to the current page returned in the response.

next.description: Link to the next page returned in the response.

post.description:
Creates a [*Customers*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/models/customer). Multiple customers can be created in one call.

**Required Fields**
* last_name
* first_name
* email

**Required Fields Customer Address**
* first_name
* city
* country_code
* state_or_province
* last_name
* address1
* postal_code

**Required Fields Attributes**
* Attributes must be [created](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/customer-attributes/customersattributespost) **BEFORE** creating a customer.
* attribute_id
* attribute_value -- This is input as a string, regardless of the [Type](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/models/type).

email.description: The email of the customer. Must be unique.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

company.description: The company of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

tax_exempt_category.description: The tax exempt category code for the customer.

customer_group_id.description: Id of the group which this customer belongs to.

addresses.description: Array of customer addresses. Limited to 10

first_name.description: The first name of the customer address.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer address.

company.description: The company of the customer address.

city.description: The city of the customer address.

postal_code.description: The postal code of the customer address.

country_code.description: The country code of the customer address.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer address.

address_type.title: Address Type
address_type.description: The address type. Residential or Commercial

attributes.description: Array of customer attributes. Limited to 10

attribute_value.description: Attribute value. This will always be a string, regardless of the attributes type.

force_password_reset.description: If `true`, this customer will be forced to change password on next login.

new_password.description: New password for customer. Write only field

accepts_product_review_abandoned_cart_em.description: It determines if the customer is signed up to receive either product review or abandoned cart emails or recieve both emails.

422.description: The *Customer* was not valid. This is the result of missing required fields or trying to edit a read only field. See the response for more details.

title.description: The error title describing the particular error.

put.description:
Updates a [*Customers*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/models/customer). Subresource updates are not supported. Multiple customers can be updated in one call.

**Required Fields**
* id -- ID of the *Customer* This must be included in the request body

**Read Only Fields**
* id
* registration_ip_address
* date_created
* date_modified


**Notes**

Attributes Values can not be updated using Update a Customer. Use the Update a [Customer Attribute Values](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/customer-attribute-values/customersattributevaluesput) endpoint.

email.description: The email of the customer. Must be unique.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

company.description: The company of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

registration_ip_address.description: The IP address from which this customer was registered.

tax_exempt_category.description: The tax exempt category code for the customer.

customer_group_id.description: Id of the group which this customer belongs to.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the customer.

force_password_reset.description: If `true`, this customer will be forced to change password on next login.

new_password.description: New password for customer. Write only field

accepts_product_review_abandoned_cart_em.description: It determines if the customer is signed up to receive either product review or abandoned cart emails or recieve both emails.

schema.title: CustomersResponse
schema.description: Response payload for the BigCommerce API.

email.description: The email of the customer. Must be unique.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

company.description: The company of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

registration_ip_address.description: The IP address from which this customer was registered.

tax_exempt_category.description: The tax exempt category code for the customer.

customer_group_id.description: Id of the group which this customer belongs to.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the customer.

date_modified.description: The date on which the customer was modified.

date_created.description: The date of which the customer was created.

force_password_reset.description: If `true`, this customer will be forced to change password on next login.

addresses.description: Array of customer addresses. Limited to 10

first_name.description: The first name of the customer address.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer address.

company.description: The company of the customer address.

city.description: The city of the customer address.

postal_code.description: The postal code of the customer address.

country_code.description: The country code of the customer address.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer address.

address_type.title: Address Type
address_type.description: The address type. Residential or Commercial

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the address.

country.description: The country name of the customer address.

form_fields.description: Array of form fields. Controlled by `formfields` parameter.

attributes.description: Array of customer attributes. Limited to 10

value.description: Attribute value. This will always be a string, regardless of the attributes type.

id.description: Attribute value ID.

date_modified.description: The date on which the customer attribute value was modified.

date_created.description: The date of which the customer attribute value was created.

form_fields.description: Array of form fields. Controlled by `formfields` parameter.

accepts_product_review_abandoned_cart_em.description: It determines if the customer is signed up to receive either product review or abandoned cart emails or recieve both emails.

delete.description:
Deletes [*Customers*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/models/customer).

**Required Query**
* id:in -- ID of the customer

**Notes**

A query is required to delete customers. If not provided, a 204 is returned, with no changes to the data.

post.description:
Creates a [*Customer Attribute*](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/models/customerattributepost). Multiple customer attributes can be created in one call.

**Required Fields**
* name
* type

**Notes**

Once the data type is set, it can not be changed. The attribute will need to be deleted then created again with the new data type. This will also delete it from the customer.

Customer attributes are created separately from the customer. After the name and type are created, then the attributes can be added to the customer.

put.description:
Upserts [*Customer Attribute Values*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/models/customerattributevalue). Updates the attribute values on the [*Customer*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api/models/customer). Multiple customer attribute values can be updated in one call.

Upsert checks for an existing record, if there is none it creates the record, if there is a matching record it updates that record.

Up to 10 per call are allowed.

**Required Fields**
* customer_id -- ID of the *Customer*
* id -- ID of the *Customer Attribute*
* value -- Value of the *Customer Attribute*

X-Auth-Client.name: X-Auth-Client
X-Auth-Client.description:
### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Customers | modify | `store_v2_customers` |
|  Customers | read-only | `store_v2_customers_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

next.description: Link to the next page returned in the response.

schema.title: CustomersResponse
schema.description: Response payload for the BigCommerce API.

email.description: The email of the customer. Must be unique.

first_name.description: The first name of the customer.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer.

company.description: The company of the customer.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer.

registration_ip_address.description: The IP address from which this customer was registered.

tax_exempt_category.description: The tax exempt category code for the customer.

customer_group_id.description: Id of the group which this customer belongs to.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the customer.

date_modified.description: The date on which the customer was modified.

date_created.description: The date of which the customer was created.

force_password_reset.description: If `true`, this customer will be forced to change password on next login.

addresses.description: Array of customer addresses. Limited to 10

first_name.description: The first name of the customer address.

last_name.description: The last name of the customer address.

company.description: The company of the customer address.

city.description: The city of the customer address.

postal_code.description: The postal code of the customer address.

country_code.description: The country code of the customer address.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer address.

address_type.title: Address Type
address_type.description: The address type. Residential or Commercial

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the address.

country.description: The country name of the customer address.

form_fields.description: Array of form fields. Controlled by `formfields` parameter.

attributes.description: Array of customer attributes. Limited to 10

value.description: Attribute value. This will always be a string, regardless of the attributes type.

id.description: Attribute value ID.

date_modified.description: The date on which the customer attribute value was modified.

date_created.description: The date of which the customer attribute value was created.

form_fields.description: Array of form fields. Controlled by `formfields` parameter.

accepts_product_review_abandoned_cart_em.description: It determines if the customer is signed up to receive either product review or abandoned cart emails or recieve both emails.

info.title: Customers V2
info.description:
- [OAuth Scopes](#oauth-scopes)
- [Authentication](#authentication)
- [Available Endpoints](#available-endpoints)
- [Usage Notes](#usage-notes)
- [Resources](#resources)

Create and Manage Customers, Customer Addresses, and Customer Groups. Additionally, validate customer passwords.

To learn more about Customers see [here](/api-docs/customers/customers-subscribers-overview). 

## OAuth Scopes
| UI Name                                      | Permission | Parameter                                     |
|----------------------------------------------|------------|-----------------------------------------------|
| Customers                                    | modify     | `store_v2_customers`                          |
| Customers                                    | read-only  | `store_v2_customers_read_only`                |

For more information on OAuth Scopes, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Authentication

Requests can be authenticated by sending a `client_id` and `access_token` via `X-Auth-Client` and `X-Auth-Token` HTTP headers:

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Accept: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Available Endpoints
| Resource / Endpoint                     | Description                                                                   |
|-----------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Customers                               | Identity and account details for customers shopping on BigCommerce stores     |
| Customers Addresses                     | Postal address belonging to a customer.                                       |
| Customers Groups                        | Groupings of customers who share the same level of access and discounts       |
| Customers Validate Password             | Validate customer passwords                                                   |

## Usage Notes

**Customer Groups**
* Customer Groups are only available on specific plans.

**Customers vs. Subscribers**
* A subscriber is not always a customer. Someone can sign up for the newsletter only and not create an account.
* A customer is not always a subscriber. Signing up for the newsletter is a separate action from creating an account and purchasing an item.
* A customer and a subscriber can be the same. If a shopper checks out on the storefront, creates an account and opts into the newsletter, they are a customer and a subscriber.

## Resources

### Related APIs / Endpoints
  [Customer Login API](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/customers/customer-login-api)
- [Current Customer API](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/customers/current-customer-api)
- [Customers API (v3)](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/customer-subscribers/v3-customers-api)
- [Subscribers API](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/customer-subscribers/subscribers-api)

### Webhooks
- [Customers](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/webhooks/webhook-events#webhook-events_customer)

get.description: Returns a list of all *Customers*. Default sorting is by customer id, from lowest to highest. Optional parameters can be passed in.

id.description: Unique numeric ID of this customer. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

_authentication.description: Not returned in any responses, but accepts up to two fields allowing you to set the customer’s password. If a password is not supplied, it is generated automatically. For further information about using this object, please see the Customers resource documentation.

company.description: The name of the company for which the customer works.

first_name.description: First name of the customer.

last_name.description: Last name of the customer.

email.description: Email address of the customer.

phone.description: Phone number of the customer.

date_created.description: Date on which the customer registered from the storefront or was created in the control panel. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

date_modified.description: Date on which the customer updated their details in the storefront or was updated in the control panel. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

store_credit.description: The amount of credit the customer has. (Float, Float as String, Integer)

registration_ip_address.description: The customer’s IP address when they signed up.

customer_group_id.description: The group to which the customer belongs.

tax_exempt_category.description: Used to identify customers who fall into special sales-tax categories – in particular, those who are fully or partially exempt from paying sales tax. Can be blank, or can contain a single AvaTax code. (The codes are case-sensitive.) Stores that subscribe to BigCommerce’s Avalara Premium integration will use this code to determine how/whether to apply sales tax. Does not affect sales-tax calculations for stores that do not subscribe to Avalara Premium.

accepts_marketing.description: If the customer accepts product review emails or abandon cart emails. Read-Only.

url.description: Full URL of where the resource is located.

form_fields.description: Array of custom fields. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

value.description: Value of the form field

reset_pass_on_login.description: Force a password change on next login.

x-unitTests.x-testDescription:
Gets the collection of customers. (Default sorting is by customer id, from lowest to highest.)
This request can be filtered by any of the _Customer_ object properties except form fields.

post.description:
Creates a *Customer*.

**Required Fields**
*   first_name
*   last_name
*   email

**Read Only Fields**
*   id
*   date_created
*   date_modified
*   accepts_marketing
*   addresses
*   form_fields

## Notes 

The `_authentication` object exposes functionality associated with the customer’s ability to log in to the store. All properties of the `_authentication` object are optional.

When the `_authentication` object is not supplied with an update request, then the existing customer password remains the same.

## Updating Passwords 

To manually update a customer password in the same way as the control panel, supply a value for the password field:

```
{
    "_authentication": {
        "password": "12w69Y217PYR96J"
    }
}
```

## Confirming Passwords 

An additional optional `password_confirmation` field can also be sent, providing password confirmation as a service:

```
{
    "_authentication": {
       "password": "12w69Y217PYR96J",
       "password_confirmation": "12w69Y217PYR96J"
    }
}
```

## Forcing Password Resets 

To force a customer to reset their password upon their next login attempt, give the `force_reset` field a value of true, as shown here:

```
{
    "_authentication": {
        "force_reset": true
    }
}

_authentication.description: This can vary depending on the action being taken to update, validate or force a password change. See Update Customer

get.description:
Returns a list of *Customer Addresses*. Returns the addresses belonging to a customer. Default sorting is by address id, from lowest to highest. 

The maximum limit is 250. If a limit isn’t provided, up to 50 `customer_addresses` are returned by default.

id.description: ID of this customer address. READ-ONLY

first_name.description: The customer’s first name.

last_name.description: The customer’s last name.

company.description: The customer’s company name.

city.description: The customer’s city/town/suburb.

state.description: The customer’s state/province. Do not abbreviate the state; spell out the entire word, e.g.: California. (Cannot be null. As a workaround for addresses that include no state/province string, pass a space as the “state” value.)

zip.description: The customer’s ZIP or postal code.

country.description: The customer’s country. Must be the full country name.

country_iso2.description: 2-letter ISO Alpha-2 code for the customer’s country. READ-ONLY

phone.description: The customer’s phone number.

Creates a new *Customer Address*. (Note: The “state” property cannot be null. As a workaround for addresses that include no state/province string, pass a space as the “state” value.)

*   last_name
*   phone
*   street_1
*   city
*   state
*   zip
*   country

**Read Only Fields**
*   id
*   country_iso2

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter customer groups by exact name match. Can use `name:like` to filter using a fuzzy matching method. This is good for implementing search.

parameters.name: is_default
parameters.description: If customers who signup are added to this group by default

parameters.name: is_group_for_guests
parameters.description: If the groups is for guests. There can only be one customer group for guests at a time.

items.title: Customer Group
items.description: When creating a customer group category discount using the API it defaults to "products in this category and its subcategories". In the [Control Panel](https://support.bigcommerce.com/s/article/Customer-Groups#pricing) this can be changed to either "products in this category only" or "products in this category and its subcategories". There are currently no settings to change this behavior via API.

id.description: Id of the customer group

is_default.description: Determines whether new customers are assigned to this group by default.

type.description:
+ `all` - Customers can access all categories
 + `specific`  - Customers can access a specific list of categories
+ `none` - Customers are prevented from viewing any of the categories in this group.

categories.description: Is an array of category IDs and should be supplied only if `type` is specific.

discount_rules.description: A collection of discount rules that are automatically applied to customers who are members of the group

amount.description: A float that specifies the value applied to the price modified

price_list_id.description: If a customer group is assigned to a price list,`method` and `amount` are not shown. `type` and `price_list_id` are returned.

is_group_for_guests.description: If the groups is for guests. There can only be one customer group for guests at a time.

X-Auth-Token.name: X-Auth-Token
X-Auth-Token.description:
### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Customers | modify | `store_v2_customers` |
|  Customers | read-only | `store_v2_customers_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

X-Auth-Client.name: X-Auth-Client
X-Auth-Client.description:
### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Customers | modify | `store_v2_customers` |
|  Customers | read-only | `store_v2_customers_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

info.title: Wishlist
info.description:
## Wishlist API
  
The Wishlist API allows a developer to create and manage customer [Wishlists](https://support.bigcommerce.com/s/article/Wishlists). A Wishlist allows you to see what your customers are interested in and saving on the store. With this information you’ll be able to create targeted campaigns to help merchants grow their business.
  Customer API OAuth scopes give you access to Wishlists API. See[OAuth Scopes](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication#authentication_oauth-scopes)

post.description:
Creates a [*Wishlist*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/wishlist-api/models/wishlist) and [*Wishlist Item*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/wishlist-api/models/wishlistitem). More than one item can be added in the POST.

**Required Fields**
* name
* customer_id

is_public.description: Whether the wishlist is available to the public.

variant_id.description: The variant ID of the product.

id.description: Wishlist ID, provided after creating a wishlist with a POST.

customer_id.description: The ID the customer to which the wishlist belongs.

is_public.description: Whether the Wishlist is available to the public.

token.description: The token of the Wishlist. This is created internally within BigCommerce. The Wishlist ID is to be used for external apps. Read-Only

id.description: The ID of the item

variant_id.description: The variant ID of the item.

401.description: Authentication information is missing or invalid.
